result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James C. Meyer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 10:44 am cases called. 12CF8, 12CF133, 13CF99 & 15CF119. Defendant James C. Meyer in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court quashes all warrants that may still be pending for 12CF8 & 08FA85. Agreement stated on record by DA Blader. 13CF99-Court addresses preliminary hearing-defendant wishes to waive the right to the preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over. Information filed. Attorney Szilagyi confirms receipt, waives formal reading.  Court states all matters now postured for sentencing.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Counts 1 & 2 of 13CF99.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads 15CF119 & 12CF133. COUNTS 4 & 5 of 12CF8-Revocation Order and Warrant received. No corrections or clarifications. Chapter 950 addressed. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Szilagyi. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 1 year WCJ on each count-consecutive to each other, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 292 days served.  Costs previously not paid re-imposed to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 13CF99-SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 4 years. Concurrent to 12CF8. CONDITIONS: Pay Child Support as ordered in Waushara County case 2008FA85. Maintain full time employment. Maintain working address and contact with Child Support. Absolute Sobriety. No Bars. No Rx w/o Rx of treating physician.  Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
12CF133, 13CF99 & 15CF119 Cases called @ 11:26 a.m. Defendant James C. Meyer in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant James C. Meyer in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.

12CF08:   Ruth Zouski appeared on the unpaid financial obligations - to track along with pending criminal matters.  Status conference scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 01:35 pm.

BOND APPLICABLE TO CASE NOS. 12CF133, 13CF99 & 15CF119. Defendant is prohibited from leaving the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is required to provide current physical and mailing address to the Clerk of Courts Office.

12CF133, 13CF99 & 15CF119 Cases called @ 1:03 p.m. Defendant James C. Meyer in court, in custody, appear via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $10,000 Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi takes no position on bond. Court orders $10,000 Cash Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State. 

12CF8 - Unpaid financial obligations to track along with the criminal matter.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 11:15 am.
